The STARE Project
The STARE Project

Delivers high-cadence time series photometry on roughly 30,000 stars (9 < V < 13) in a typical field centered on the galactic plane.
Delivers high-cadence time
series photometry on roughly
30,000 stars (9 < V < 13) in a
typical field centered on the
galactic plane.

We obtain sufficient precision on 5,000 stars to detect a close-in Jupiter-sized companion.
We obtain sufficient precision
on 5,000 stars to detect a
close-in Jupiter-sized
companion.

We have 20 orbits of STIS data (290 – 1030 nm) spanning 4 times of secondary eclipse. The photon noise limit of these data would permit a detection threshold of p = 0.1, averaged over the entire bandpass.
We have 20 orbits of STIS data (290 – 1030 nm) spanning 4 times of
secondary eclipse. The photon noise limit of these data would permit
a detection threshold of p = 0.1, averaged over the entire bandpass.

These data will allow us to quantify the net energy deposition into the planet.
These data will allow us to quantify the net
energy deposition into the planet.
